intro: Lysipomia glandulifera subsp. glandulifera, commonly known as the glandular lysipomia, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges, and is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, clustered inflorescences with tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in wetlands or along streams. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies in its native habitat.
